metadata.title: CVE-2016-9933 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Stack consumption vulnerability in the gdImageFillToBorder function in gd.cin the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.2, as used in PHP before5.6.28 and 7.x before 7.0.13, allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (segmentation violation) via a crafted imagefilltoborder call thattriggers use of a negative color value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.6
libgd3 - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3ubuntu0.6').
